description: TEHRAN - In a note, Shargh discussed the European troika’s activation of the snapback mechanism against Iran.
title: Fateful circumstances

description: TEHRAN – When Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian was vying for the presidency last year, his willingness to give diplomacy with the West another chance was his main point of distinction from his conservative rival, Saeed Jalili, who has likened negotiating Iran's nuclear program with the West to the biblical story of the Israelites worshipping a "golden calf." Perhaps Iranians voted for Pezeshkian because they believed a diplomatic solution with the West was still possible.
title: Another blow to diplomacy

description: TEHRAN – In an exclusive interview with the Tehran Times, Silvia Boltuc, an Italian geopolitical analyst and Managing Director of Special Eurasia, analyzes how a foreign-operated corridor could reshape Iran’s strategic environment in the South Caucasus.
title: Exclusive: Iran must adopt dual-track strategy to secure Caucasus role, says Italian analyst

description: TEHRAN – Argentine diplomat Rafael Mariano Grossi, director-general of the International Atomic Energy Agency (IAEA), has officially confirmed his intention to run for the post of United Nations secretary-general when António Guterres’ term ends in January 2027.
title: Tehran Times exclusive vindicated: IAEA Chief declares UN Secretary-General bid

description: TEHRAN – Iranian President Masoud Pezeshkian has described relations between the Islamic Republic of Iran and the People’s Republic of China as “strategic,” stressing that Tehran is a reliable partner for Beijing in political, economic, and international arenas—particularly in confronting unilateralism.
title: Pezeshkian calls China a strategic partner for Iran ahead of Beijing visit

description: TEHRAN – China is set to host two major international events in the near future: the Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) Summit and the commemoration of the 80th anniversary of the end of World War II.
title: On the president’s visit to China

description: As China prepares to mark the 80th anniversary of its victory in the War of Resistance against Japanese Aggression on Sept. 3, a remote town in central China's Hubei Province is quietly staging a powerful act of remembrance.
title: Across China: American journalist's photos and writing rekindle China's wartime memories

description: TEHRAN – Yemen’s Defense Ministry in Sanaa denies Israeli claims that recent airstrikes targeted and assassinated leaders from the Ansarallah movement
title: Yemen denies Israeli assassination claims

description: BEIRUT — Since the resistance liberated southern Lebanon in 2000, addressing the issue of Lebanese collaborators with the Israeli entity has remained one of the key tests of the Lebanese state’s resolve in safeguarding national security.
title: Army strongly opposes plan to pit Lebanese against each other

description: TEHRAN – Israel’s brutal war on the Gaza Strip, combined with its deliberate starvation policy, continues unchecked in the besieged Palestinian territory.
title: 500+ UN staff demand Israel’s Gaza war be called genocide

description: The Shanghai Cooperation Organization (SCO) Summit is set to shine in Tianjin. Ahead of the summit, experts have been gathering at Tianjin Port where China drives connectivity and free trade for the Global South. How does China's vision empower SCO nations to foster economic growth and regional stability? Can Tianjin Port's AI-driven automation help advance global trade for SCO members? And how can the SCO unite diverse nations to hedge Western protectionism and promote inclusive prosperity?
title: How does China's SCO vision empower the Global South?

description: TEHRAN - At a meeting between the chairman of the National Library and Archives of Iran (NLAI) Gholamreza Amirkhani and the Ambassador of Tajikistan Nizomiddin Zohidi in Tehran on Wednesday, both sides emphasized the exchange of resources, dispatch of researchers, and the organization of joint workshops.
title: NLAI chairman appreciates distribution of “Shahnameh” in Tajikistan

description: TEHRAN – Homa Theater in Tehran will stage the romantic comedy play “Twelfth Night” by William Shakespeare from September 1.
title: Homa Theater will stage Shakespeare’s “Twelfth Night”

description: TEHRAN – The Israeli military on Friday declared Gaza City a “dangerous combat zone,” ending the so-called “tactical pauses” that had allowed limited food deliveries into the besieged north. The move has heightened fears of another mass displacement as Israel prepares what appears to be a major ground assault.
title: Israel's chilling assault on Gaza City

description: TEHRAN – Iran came back from a goal down to defeat Afghanistan 3-1 in the opening match of the 2025 CAFA Nations Cup on Friday.
title: Iran defeat Afghanistan in 2025 CAFA Nations Cup

description: TEHRAN—Kermanshah Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts Department has invited 13 Iraqi travel agencies to the western province in an effort to attract tourists from the neighboring country and exploit the investment potential in the tourism industry.
title: Kermanshah invites 13 Iraqi travel agencies to boost tourism

description: TEHRAN – The second edition of the International Specialized Exhibition of Gemstones, Machinery & Related Equipment is currently underway at the Tehran International Permanent Fairgrounds, with participation from domestic and foreign activists in the gemstone industry, said Farzad Ojani, an official with the Ministry of Cultural Heritage, Tourism, and Handicrafts.
title: Intl. expo of semi-precious stones underway in Tehran

description: TEHRAN— Concurrent with Iran’s Government Week (Aug. 23-29), 50 bikers departed from Tehran for Sari, Mazandaran province, on 250 cc motorcycles in the form of a tourist tour rally dedicated to promoting road safety.
title: Tehran-Sari motorcycle rally flagged off to promote road safety

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Minister of Cultural Heritage, Tourism and Handicrafts has said that the Armenian National Philharmonic Orchestra will stage a concert on Sept. 6 at Persepolis, the UNESCO World Heritage site near Shiraz, to mark the orchestra’s 100th anniversary.
title: Armenian Philharmonic Orchestra to perform at Persepolis, minister confirms

description: TEHRAN – Iran will host its first festival and exhibition on children and youth tourism in Tehran from Sept. 29 to Oct. 3, a senior official said on Wednesday.
title: Iran to host debut tourism expo focused on children and teens

description: TEHRAN – Iran lost to India 22-21 at the 2025 Asian Women’s Junior Handball Championship fifth-sixth place match on Friday.
title: Iran finish sixth at the 2025 Asian Women’s Junior Handball Championship

description: TEHRAN - Brazil, Portugal, Morocco, Iran, Costa Rica and New Zealand continue to lead their respective confederations in the FIFA Futsal Men’s World Ranking.
title: Iran still fifth in FIFA Futsal Men’s World Ranking

description: TEHRAN –Haider Abd Dahed, the Iraqi deputy minister of higher education and scientific research, is on a trip to Iran to foster scientific relations between the two countries.
title: Iraqi higher education official in Tehran to boost ties

description: TEHRAN - The latest edition of the FIFA Futsal Women’s World Ranking features 12 new teams, reflecting the booming popularity of the game ahead of the inaugural FIFA Futsal Women’s World Cup in the Philippines, which kicks off this coming November.
title: Iran unchanged in FIFA Futsal Women’s World Ranking

description: Israeli forces arrested three Palestinians near Hebron in the occupied West Bank, Wafa reported Friday. One man was detained during a raid on al‑Fawwar refugee camp, while two others were seized at a checkpoint near as‑Samu.
title: Israel arrests three Palestinians in West Bank raids

description: Microsoft has dismissed four employees who joined workplace protests against the tech giant’s contracts with Israel amid its ongoing war on Gaza.
title: Microsoft fires four employees over Gaza war protest

description: TEHRAN – Tehran will play host to the sixth international conference with the theme of Iran's smart cities and artificial intelligence, which is scheduled to be held from November 4 to 6.
title: Intl. conference on Iran's smart cities, AI slated for November

description: TEHRAN – Concerning the significance of integrating new technologies into the healthcare system, a trilateral memorandum of understanding (MOU) has been signed to promote the country's status in the plasma medicine industry.
title: MOU signed to accelerate plasma medicine industry’s growth

description: TEHRAN - When wars break out, the news usually focuses on the tragic loss of human lives, injuries, and damage to buildings and infrastructure. But behind these visible horrors lies a similarly harrowing, though less visible, consequence of wars—one that rarely gets the attention it deserves: the long-lasting harm war does to the environment.
title: The environmental toll of war: a crisis we often overlook

description: TEHRAN - In today’s digital era, data has become the invisible fuel driving innovation. From the way doctors diagnose illnesses to how cities manage traffic and how apps recommend our next favorite song, data is at the core of progress. Yet with all of this potential comes a serious dilemma: how do we balance the power of innovation with the responsibility of protecting people’s privacy?
title: Balancing innovation and privacy in the digital age

description: TEHRAN – Iran produces around 560,000 tons of aluminum ingots annually, below its installed capacity of more than 650,000 tons, due to recurring shortages of electricity and natural gas, the head of the Iranian Aluminum Industries Syndicate said.
title: Annual aluminum output reaches 560,000 tons amid energy shortages

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Trade Promotion Organization (TPO) has called on private companies to take greater advantage of growing opportunities in Arab markets, a senior official said.
title: TPO urges private sector to expand economic ties with Arab states

description: TEHRAN – Iran supplied more than 22 billion liters of liquid fuel to power plants in the Iranian year 1403 (March 2024–March 2025), a 40 percent increase from the previous year, the Oil Ministry said.
title: Annual supply of liquid fuel to power plants rises 40%

description: Israel's military declared an end to a so-called "tactical pause" in Gaza City on Friday, labeling the famine-ravaged area a "dangerous combat zone."
title: Israel announces end to 'tactical pause' in famine‑hit Gaza City

description: At least 41 Palestinians have been killed in Israeli attacks across Gaza since dawn on Friday, Al Jazeera reported, citing Gaza hospital sources.
title: Israeli strikes in southern Gaza kill aid seekers, hit shelter for displaced

description: TEHRAN – Iran swept past China in straight sets (25-21, 25-16, 25-15 ) in the 2025 FIVB Volleyball Men’s U21 World Championship on Friday.
title: Iran advance to 2025 FIVB U21 World Championship semis

description: TEHRAN – Iran has inaugurated a series of road and transport projects worth 329.01 trillion rials (about $6.63 billion) during Government Week, the head of the Road Maintenance and Transportation Organization said.
title: Over $6.6b worth of transport projects inaugurated during Government Week

description: TEHRAN – Iranian Energy Ministry has inaugurated 150 megawatts of solar power plants across eight provinces, most of them in 3.0 MW units, Energy Minister Abbas Aliabadi said at a ceremony marking Government Week.
title: Energy Ministry brings 150 MW of solar power plants online across 8 provinces

description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi will land in China this weekend for his first visit in seven years. He will meet Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russian President Vladimir Putin, just as India’s ties with Washington have soured.
title: India’s Modi to meet Xi and Putin on first China trip in seven years

description: A Thai court removed suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office on Friday, ruling that her controversial phone call with Cambodia’s former leader breached ethics rules, in a move that plunges the kingdom into fresh political turmoil, CNN reported.
title: Thailand’s prime minister removed from office

description: TEHRAN – Iran’s Ambassador to Russia Kazem Jalali, met Russian Transport Minister Andrey Nikitin to discuss key transport projects, including the long-delayed Rasht–Astara railway, the Iranian Embassy in Moscow said.
title: Tehran, Moscow discuss Rasht–Astara railway, potential Caspian cruise line

description: TEHRAN – Iran and Belarus have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) on aviation engineering and technical cooperation, which includes mutual recognition of airworthiness certification, the Civil Aviation Organization of Iran said.
title: Iran, Belarus sign airworthiness cooperation deal

description: TEHRAN – Iran and Pakistan have increased their flight capacity from 15 to 24 weekly services for each side, the Civil Aviation Organization of Iran said.
title: Iran, Pakistan expand flight capacity to 24 weekly services

description: TEHRAN – Sepahan football club has completed the signing of Georgian defender Giorgi Gvelesiani on Friday.
title: Sepahan complete signing of ex-Persepolis defender Gvelesiani
